intro: Dodecatheon thornense, commonly known as the Thorny Meadow Rue, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, characterized by its showy, often yellow or white flowers. The plant features a hairy stem and pinnately compound leaves, typical of many members of its family. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Dodecatheon thornense is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
